channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report I-2024100135
item.description:
Report I-2024100135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: Chattanooga
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 10/02/2024 drums were picked up from Univar Solutions Norcross facility and delivered to Univar Solutions in Chattanooga. When arriving in Chattanooga the supervisor at the plant noticed a small amount of product coming out of the trailer towards the nose. When opening the door there was one drum of 40 discovered to be leaking. Hepaco was called on site and maintained/handled the cleanup. It was discovered that a drum was punctured by a nail on a pallet losing approximately 3301bs of sodium bisulfite. It looked like the drum may have shifted slightly and hit the nail. When leaving Norcross there were not any issues or signs of damage to the drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090548
item.description:
Report E-2024090548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-24T09:29:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: MORGANTOWN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COWAN TRANSPORT SERVICES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On September 18, 2024, Cowan Intermodal Group, LLC contacted Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a release in Morgantown, WV. It was reported an undetermined amount of BelcleneÂ® 200 was due to a single vehicle accident was caused by the truck striking a guardrail and flipping onto its side, the release impacted soil, asphalt and a nearby storm drain. It was also reported the impacted area was 60ft by 30ft and approximately 5000 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors contacted DOT to provide traffic control to excavate the damaged travel lines. Excavation was complete asphalt milling and a surface scrape that measured 85ft by 8ft area. 2 roll offs containing impacted soil and 3 roll off boxes of asphalt milling were collected. There were 16 totes total involved. The product was vacuumed out of the bottom of the trailer into 1 vac truck and 9 different totes for transfer. The 16 damaged totes were placed in 2 roll off boxes and staged at a near by DOT site. All waste generated was taken off-site for proper disposal.
